thread.title: Season Tickets? Steak Dinners? Small Firms Rethink Client Events After Losing Tax Break

author: Ruth Simon
title: Season Tickets? Steak Dinners? Small Firms Rethink Client Events After Losing Tax Break
text:
A wholesale distributor plans to replace some expense-account lunches with open houses for customers. A marketing firm has stopped reimbursing employees’ commuting expenses and is giving them raises instead. A tax-audit defense firm is giving up its season tickets to Sacramento Kings basketball games.
These are some of the ways small-business owners are responding to changes in the tax law that reduce or eliminate some popular deductions for meals, entertainment and transportation, though many of the fine points are unclear....
